PREFACE
PREFACE
line: There is something grotesque in the idea of a prose translation of a

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: poet, though the practice is become so common that it has ceased to

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: provoke a smile or demand an apology. The language of poetry is language

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: in fusion; that of prose is language fixed and crystallised; and an

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: attempt to copy the one material in the other must always count on

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: failure to convey what is, after all, one of the most essential things

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: in poetry,--its poetical quality. And this is so with Virgil more,

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: perhaps, than with any other poet; for more, perhaps, than any other

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: poet Virgil depends on his poetical quality from first to last. Such a

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: translation can only have the value of a copy of some great painting

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: executed in mosaic, if indeed a copy in Berlin wool is not a closer

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: analogy; and even at the best all it can have to say for itself will be

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: in Virgil's own words, _Experiar sensus; nihil hic nisi carmina desunt._

Poem Title: PREFACE
PREFACE
line: In this translation I have in the main followed the text of Conington

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: and Nettleship. The more important deviations from this text are

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: mentioned in the notes; but I have not thought it necessary to give a

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: complete list of various readings, or to mention any change except where

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: it might lead to misapprehension. Their notes have also been used by me

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: throughout.

Poem Title: PREFACE
PREFACE
line: Beyond this I have made constant use of the mass of ancient commentary

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: going under the name of Servius; the most valuable, perhaps, of all, as

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: it is in many ways the nearest to the poet himself. The explanation

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: given in it has sometimes been followed against those of the modern

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: editors. To other commentaries only occasional reference has been made.

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: The sense that Virgil is his own best interpreter becomes stronger as

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: one studies him more.

Poem Title: PREFACE
PREFACE
line: My thanks are due to Mr. EVELYN ABBOTT, Fellow and Tutor of Balliol, and

Poem Title: PREFACE
line: to the Rev. H. C. BEECHING, for much valuable suggestion and criticism.
